FuncDef: The display pim ipv6 control-message counters command displays the number of sent and received IPv6 PIM control messages. The display pim ipv6 control-message counters command displays the number of sent and received IPv6 PIM control messages. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
CLIs: display pim ipv6 control-message counters [ message-type { crp | probe | register | register-stop } ]
display pim ipv6 { vpn-instance <instance-name> | all-instance } control-messagecounters [ message-type { crp | probe | register | register-stop } ]

display pim ipv6 { vpn-instance <instance-name> | all-instance } control-messagecountersinterface { <interface-type> <interface-number> | <interface-name> } [ message-type { assert | bsr | hello | join-prune } ]

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates the type of a PIM message.
-

Displays the number of C-RP messages.
-

Indicates the number of Probe messages.
-

Displays the number of Register messages.
-

Specifies the name of a VPN instance.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 characters.

Specifies the type and number of an interface.
-

Indicates the number of Assert messages.
-

Indicates the number of BootStrap router (BSR) messages.
-

Indicates the number of Hello messages.
-

Indicates the number of Join/Prune messages.
-
